Title: N/A

reviewText: I highly disagree with reviewers who said this is the worst PPV of all time. Its not the greatest PPV they ever put on but its diffently not the worst one ive ever seen.MNM VS Animal and Heidenrich: I dont know why the called this LOD. Animal is out of shape but can still wrestle. The match was a fun opener but ruined by commentary. Cole says that LOD never won the Smackdown tag titles (not crap since Hawk died a few years back) and what a coo it would be if they could win it for Hawk. Meaning, the new LOD will win the tag titles at least for a few weeks. Good match but the ending didnt send chills up my spine like it did to Michael Cole.Booker T VS Christian: Match of the night. I think someone called this match average but its way better then average. Ill admit Christian is not the greatest wrestler ever but can put on a match sometimes. This is one of those times. I loved the ending to the match.Chris Benoit VS Orlando Jordan: This is where the show gets boring. I hated Jordans run as US champion because he never did anything. Of course, a month later Benoit would destory Jordan in 30 seconds for the title. This match though was far too long.The Undertaker VS Mohammed Hassan: Dumb match. The ending though was something to see.Mexicools VS BWO: They gave 3 talented wrestlers (Mexicools) five minutes to wrestle. StupidEddie Guerrero VS Rey Mysterio: Great story to lead up to this match. The match ended out of nowheres but was a great match. They'd have a even better match at Summerslam but still a good match.Melina VS Torrie Wilson: BATHROOM BREAK!!!!!JBL VS Batista: Loved JBL's entrance here. The match was boring and not the best match ive seen. Ending suckedOverall, a good PPV with a few bad matches. I saw a house saw with mostly the same card and it was way better then this PPV. Also, Ric Flair-Sting was an extra on the dvd and a reason why I bought the dvd. It was a good match but nothing to speical.
summary: Not the lowest point in WWE dvd history
Title: N/A

reviewText: The only reason I bought this is I am trying to collect as many wrestling dvds as possible. This was definitely one of the worst PPVs. Heres a match listing:WWE Tag Team ChampionshipLOD vs. MNMPoor match. I absolutely hate what they have done to the L.O.D. legacy. You have one the most dominate tag teams ever, then you put in a jobber like Heidenrich and it is all down hill from there. I can respect the passion Animal still has but why would you be paired with Heidenrich? The "L.O.D." win the titles.Booker T vs. ChristianAnother bad match. Booker T wins, not much else happened.United States ChampionshipOrlando Jordan vs. Chris BenoitTerrible! Chris Benoit is a former World Champion and to have him lose to a low-to-mid card wrestler like Jordan is pathetic.Undertaker vs. Muhammad HassanThis match really saved the PPV. For A few reasons. First, it was really a pretty good match. Second, it was Muhammed Hassan's first loss and his last match. And Lastly, The Great American Bash Of 2005 will be known as the PPV that the Undertaker gave Hassan the Last Ride through the stage, instead of being known as a poor PPV.Mexicools vs. BWOAll I will say is that this was a decent match at best.Rey Mysterio vs. Eddie GuerreroMatch of the PPV! I love watching these 2 wrestle. They saved the PPV. Nobody works this well together like this except for maybe Eddie and Chris Benoit. Great match!Melina vs. Torrie WilsonAnother waste of time.World Heavyweight ChampionshipBatista vs JBLThis was a good match. Too much outside interference. Batista used a chair that Orlando Jordan brought in the ring on both Jordan and JBL so he gets DQ'ed. I don't like the Batista was screwed. He should have wonthis one. Great Aftermath, too!Unless you are an avid Wrestling fan, trying to buy every DVD available, DON'T buy this one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was better than last year's and fairly entertaining.  Plus I'll address this and not TNA et alWWE Tag Team ChampionshipMNM vs. Road Warrior Animal/HeidenreichGood way to start things off.  Slow in the beginning but it picks up and the crowd chants LOD and gives a big pop after the win.  Loved that it was dedicated to Hawk.Christian vs. Booker TNot bad.  They've already feuded two years ago so I was surprised they went with this.  Liked the ending.United States ChampionshipOrlando Jordan vs. Chris BenoitOJ isn't a bad talent at all.  He's just never proven himself.  He's no where near Benoit's caliber.  Decent match with the wrong man going over but Benoit makes Jordon look like a million bucks.  Cool standing O for the wolverine afterwards.#1 Contender Match for the World Heavyweight ChampionshipUndertaker vs. Muhammad HassanIf not for the controversy, we all know Hassan goes over here.  Somewhat slow but the very and and subsequent mele after the match make up for it nicely.Bra and Panties MatchTorrie Wilson vs. MelinaYes, they're hot, no they don't have talent.  Yes this sucks.If Eddie Wins He Reveals His SecretEddie Guerrero vs. Rey MysterioGreat match.  I really thought Eddie would pull it off but a surprise roll up ends that.  Although he revealed his secret on the very next show so it doesn't matter anyway.World Heavyweight ChampionshipBatista vs. JBLI like wrestling matches and I like brawls such as this.  It was rather plodding but they beat the hell out of each other.  DQ ending stinks but two Batista bombs is a picker upper.
summary: A Review about the actual event...
Title: N/A

reviewText: My Review for the Great American Bash 2005WWE Tag Team ChampionshipMNM v. Legion of Doom **Run of the mill opener with a hot crowd for the title change. This was plenty of fun and a good way to get the crowd going, but had a ton of breakdowns and thanks to Animal's less than stellar ring shape at the time, had it's fair share of botched spots. Good opener, extremely mediocre match.Booker T v. Christian **1/2Very run of the mill match between these two and Christian's second to last appearance on a WWE pay per view. These two, IMO, are capable of better and it was clearly obvious that both were merely running through the motions in this one. Not a bad match really, just extremely average.US ChampionshipChris Benoit v. Orlando Jordan **1/2Far too long. This should have been 12 minutes on the dot with a much faster pace. In all honesty the psychology and much of what was done made a TON of sense. It was the pacing that threw this match into the gutter. If they had cut 5-10 minutes out of this puppy people would be talking about it. Alas, they didn't and it really muffed the entire match.The Undertaker v. Mohammed Hassan **3/4Much better than I expected but painfully predictable heading in with Hassan and the situation with UPN. They did a good job of things out there and gave the Hassan character the send off he likely deserved.Mexicools v. bWo **yawn*This was interjected for the sake of interjection. No build, no nothing. The most entertaining part of the match are the MC's entrances on the lawn mowers and Blue Meanie spinning out a big wheel down the ramp. Other than that, this was a stinker.Rey Mysterio v. Eddie Guererro ***Solid work by both and I was settled in for a good 30 minute match judging by the pacing. Eddie hits a brutal brain buster on Rey Rey and then..... gets rolled up. Which completely befuddled me and to be honest, pissed me off. These guys were on pace for a moty contender and it ended literally out of nowhere. Unfortuante, but still far and away the match of the night.Bra and Panties MatchMelina v. Torrie DUDMelina's hot, so is torrie, horay for ta tas.. back to wrestlingWorld Heavyweight ChampionshipBatista v. JBL *1/2How this WASN'T booked as a street fight is beyond me and the match was set up for failure before the opening bell even hit. Wrestling is all about maximizing strengths and minimizing weaknesses. Neither of these guys can wrestle. But they can brawl. Why restrain them? This was unbelievably bad with nothing making any sense whatsoever. This could be a contender for the worst World title match on pay per view in a long, long time.Overall D: If there was one word to describe GAB 2005, i'd use the world flat. Everything just came off plodding for some reason. Nothing really memorable and nothing even really 'good'. What was bordering on good was cut off. Dangerously bad pay per view for the WWE and ranks VERY low on this year's scale.
Title: N/A

reviewText: WWE The Great American Bash wasn't the best WWE Pay Per View out of some of the last ones. If you would compare this to Vengeance, this Pay Per View would get it's ass kicked. Anyways, here are the matches of this Pay Per View.WWE Smackdown presents The Great American BashHSBC ArenaBuffalo, N.Y.July 24, 20051) WWE Tag Team ChampionshipLOD vs. MNMThis match was a pretty good opener and saved us from the next match. It was great to see one of the Road Warriors back for once. Heidenreich actually made a good performance in his match. Animal and Heidenreich win the Tag Team Titles. 3/52) Booker T vs. ChristianThis match was saved by the opener because this match sucked. Booker T saved the match because he was putting some good moves in the match. Booker T defeated Christian. Nothing else. 2/53) United States ChampionshipOrlando Jordan vs. Chris BenoitThis match wasn't that great because it was probably Orlando's worst win in his history of wrestling. This was Chris' worst match as well. I think that he had a much better performance at Summerslam even though that the match was only twenty five seconds. 3/54) Undertaker vs. Muhammad HassanThis match was one of those matches that pretty much made the Pay Per View. The match was a pretty good one. Hassan has finally been beaten in a match. The end of the match made it perfect. When Hassan got a Last Ride into the bottom of the titantron, it was pretty cool when it happened. 4/55) Mexicools vs. BWOThis match was actually a very good match. I enjoyed this match because we got to see the Mexicools fight and we got to see BWO fight. This was probably the third best match of the night. 3.5/56) Rey Mysterio vs. Eddie GuerreroThis was probably the best match at the Pay Per View. It had a lot of action and I found this to be a great story line between Eddie Guerrero and Rey Mysterio. These two have had lots of great battles. Although this wasn't the best one, it was pretty awesome. 4.5/57) Bra & Panties MatchMelina vs. Torrie WilsonThis was a great match. It's nice to actually see a good Diva match. I found it very entertaining as well. It was probably the best match as well. It was good to see these two divas in their Bra & Panties. 4/58) World Heavyweight ChampionshipJBL vs. BatistaThis match would've been an awesome match if it wasn't for O.J. I thought that Batista would've had this match won, but O.J. came in and interfered. Batista had to use the chair to defend himself against the two and got disqualified in the process. I think that there have been better matches than between these two. 4/5Overall, this PPV got a 28/40, which equals to a 70%. This PPV wasn't as good as Vengeance though.
summary: Not the Better WWE Pay Per View
Title: N/A

reviewText: KEY:91 - 100 - Perfect. A flawless PPV, you must buy this. Without a doubt this belongs in everyone's wrestling collection.81 - 90 - Superb. An outstanding PPV, I highly recommend that you buy this.71 - 80 - Great. A first-rate PPV, certainly worth your money.61 - 70 - Good. A satisfying PPV. Perhaps buy this if you really feel you want it.51 - 60 - Fair. An average PPV. It is worth a look, not your money.41 - 50 - Mediocre. A dull PPV. - Perhaps take a look at this if you get a chance, I don't recommend it though.31 - 40 - Poor. An unsatisfactory PPV - Maybe for hardcore wrestling fans, not for anyone else.21 - 30 - Bad. A lousy PPV - This is not worth a look from anyone.11 - 20 - Terrible. An awful PPV - Stay away from this and make sure you never see it.1 - 10 - Abysmal. An appalling PPV - This is just a waste of time.WWE GREAT AMERICAN BASH 2005:MNM vs. Heidenreich & "Road Warrior" Animal - 6.5/10Not a bad opener but nothing great either. Boring for the most part with a few good spots of brief entertaining wrestling. Animal didn't look like he was in good shape and this probably affected the quality of the match.Christian vs. Booker T - 6/10I didn't expect much from this, a very average match to say the least. I've seen these two have better matches on smackdown. Clearly a match put in to pass the time, nothing terrible but once again nothing amazing.Orlando Jordan vs. Chris Benoit - 5.5/10It's rare that I give a Benoit match such a low rating but this was very disappointing. The two men didn't seem to work well together, the match was void of excitement and intensity, it was plain out boring and the ending sucked.The Undertaker vs. Muhammad Hassan - 7/10The match itself was certainly not something I would watch again, it probably deserves a 5 rating. The only reason this gets pulled up to a 7 is because of the events that took place after the match ended.Undertaker beating on Hassan's helpers was probably the most exciting part of the PPV. Davari takes a sick shot when his head gets smashed hard into the announcer's table. The power bomb through the stage clearly involved Hassan landing on padding but none the less is was entertaining and the crowd were really into it.The Mexicools vs. The BWO - 6/10To be honest I was looking forward to seeing this match. I expected ECW chants and i was pleased that i heard them. The match itself disappointed me, it was way too short. I expected each member of the Mexicools to do some great high risk move but it seemed that Juvi seemed to be trying all the high flying stuff. For the short time it lasted it was entertaining.Eddie Guerrero vs. Rey Mysterio - 6.5/10This dragged on way too long. It should have been no DQ so the real intensity could be portrayed with some hardcore action. Most of the match consisted of Eddie going out to Rey's son. I expected more from this. Yes it had some good spots but it is far from memorable.Batista vs. JBL - 6.5/10Giving this a 6.5 is probably pretty generous. The match was slow paced and nearly all brawling. The sad thing is that this was the main event. Nothing great from both men. The ending was a bit surprising. I wasn't expecting this to end on a DQ. The only reason this is a 6.5 is because of Batista's anger at the end of the show where he assaults JBL and Orlando with chairs and power bombs.SCORE:46/80 (58/100)According to the key, I have rated this PPV as 'Fair, an average PPV. It is worth a look, not your money'. To be honest i feel that even this rating is too generous. This is certainly not worth anyone's money and i also feel that i am wrong in saying that it is worth a look. I feel that it is not even worth a look. It is too average for a PPV. Most of the matches felt like television matches, not PPV ones.

reviewText: This was such crap! I quote my buddy David Long when he says, "This must have been a conspriracy against the guys drafted from RAW!" And yes ALL OF THEM, including Randy Orton (and I'll explain later)...well here we go...Match #1 MNM (c) vs. Animal and Heidenreich for the WWE Tag Titles: OMG, WHAT A LET DOWN! Animal and Heidenreich pull out the win after the Dooms Day Device on Mercury!!! What a bunch of crap! Animal will not be around that long, he is only here to promote the DVD...and Heidenreich...UGH! Hopefully MNM gets these back at Summerslam! 6/10 for Animal's tribute to Hawk at the end!Match #2 Christian vs. Booker T: First instance in a RAW drafted superstar getting the hose down! Christian was being pushed like a dream on RAW, now he is reduced to two huge loses since coming to Smackdown! He should have won the #1 Contenders match and been in the main event with Batista! A decent wrestling match where Book finishes Christian off with a scissor kick off the second rope! 7/10Match #3 Orlando Jordan (c) vs. Chris Benoit for the US Title: Ok I could rant all day long here!!! But I'll try to keep it to a minimum...Anyways, Jordan is a horrible US champ! This was probably the match of his career! Benoit made him look like a BILLION bucks, like he always does for everyone!!! Benoit should have won and brought some prestige back to this dead title! Maybe they didn't let him win because he is Canadian and it was the Great AMERICAN Bash, or maybe the WWE is just retarded! Anyways, Jordan romoves the padding on the turnbuckle and Benoit gets knocked out by it...Jordan doesn't even use a finisher on him or anything! RAW drafted superstar #2 to be screwed, but atleast he got a standing ovation afterwards...7/10 for Benoit, the GREATEST EVER!!!Match #4 The Undertaker vs. Muhammad Hassan #1 contenders match: If the whole UPN crap didn't happen, then we know Hassan would have won! But Taker won and destroyed everything in site after the match!!! The match was decent, but the aftermath was AWESOME! Taker mutilates HASSAN with a vicious last ride through the stage!!! bye bye Hassan! This is where RAW drafted star #3 and #4 get screwed...#3 being Hassan and #4 being Orton! Orton was suppose to interfere here costing Taker the match...but we'll just have to wait till Smackdown! for that...7/10 for the aftermath...Match #5 BwO vs. The Mexicools: Really good for such a short match! Nova suffers a NASTY running drop kick by Super Crazy, OUCH! then Stevie Richards gets his ass kicked all over and pinned...Blue Meanie didn't do ANYTHING here except trot his lard all over the place, HAHA! I'll give both teams credit for humorous entrances with Mexicools on their JUAN Deere's and BwO on their big wheels! 8/10Match #6 Eddie Guererro vs. Rey Mysterio yet again...: Match of the night, but that isn't saying much. Rey's son Dominic was at ringside and Eddie kept looking at him, taunting him, and it even looked like Eddie was gonna snap his neck or something at one point! It was pretty tasteless...but anyways, what happened in the ring was great! Eddie almost had this won yet again after a huge frog splash, but he gave rey just enough time to recover to surprise roll him up for the win! And when this feud finally does end, Rey will still be undefeated against Eddie! Secret to be revealed on Smackdown! cuz Eddie is a LIAR, hahaha! 8/10Match #7 Melina vs. Torrie Wilson w/ Candice Michelle as SGR in a Bra & Panties match: LAME! Technically Melina won, but really EVERYBODY wins here!!! All 3 ladies down to bra & panties, and everybody leaves happy...don't quite get why this was right before the main event though cuz it killed the crowd! 4/10 for the PUPPIES!Match #8 Batista (c) vs. JBL for the World Heavyweight Title: One of the biggest let downs of the night and probably the YEAR! This match was so BORING, probably Batista's worst, but JBL has had worse matches...I don't believe the crap about them blaming this on Batista's in ring work. He sold like a dream for JBL and JBL couldn't do anything to carry this match at all! HE SUCKED! And the DQ finish was CRAP, ABSOLUTE CRAP! HHH couldn't beat Batista in 3 tries yet JBL pulls out the victory here...STUPID! RAW drafted superstar #5 getting screwed here but at least he was granted the pleasure of destroying jBL and Orlando Jordan with the steel chair and Batista Bombs afterwards...JBL vs. Batista 2 at Summerslam and I hope Batista gets a clean win over JBL in his hometown! 6/10 for Batista!!!Don't buy this...it's not even worth adding up the points and giving it a score. Just watch it or something but don't buy it!

reviewText: WWE Tag Team ChampionshipMNM vs Animal & Heidenreich 7/10- a pretty decent match. not as good as it could have been. Animal is fat but still moves pretty good. Heidenreich is NOT Hawk! He tries to carry the match but he is not very good. Animal's tribute to Hawk was touching. i miss the greatest tag team ever,The Legion Of Doom-The Road Warriors.Christian vs Booker T 7/10- an average match. these 2 have had better matches in 2003 on Raw. Sharmelle is starting to wear her welcome out.United States ChampionshipOrlando Jordan vs Chris Benoit 6/10- this has to be Benoit's worst match ever! he looked like he was holding back. Jordan is the worst U.S champ ever! an average match.#1 Contender's MatchMuhammed Hassan vs Undertaker 7/10- this was not a great match. Hassan cannot wrestle. Daiviri & the masked men had to keep getting involved. when the Undertaker has to carry a match,that's bad. the aftermath is what boosts the rating on this one.Mexicools vs Blue World Order 5/10- seemed like a Smackdown match. was way too short & rushed. these 6 deserved more time to make something out of it. hope WWE doesn't ruin these guys.Eddie Guerrero vs Rey Mysterio(if Eddie wins, he tells the secret;if Rey wins, it stays quiet) 7.5/10- this was the best match of the night with a 7.5 rating. these 2 have had better matches. having Dominick at ringside distracts from the match. Eddie keeps going out of the ring to him. this could have been a whole lot better.Bra & Panties MatchSpecial Guest Referee: Candace MichelleMelina vs Torrie Wilson 0/10- an utterly despicable waste of time. this garbage doesn't belong on ppv. show it on Smackdown if you have to.World Heavyweight ChampionshipBatista vs John Bradshaw Layfield 6.5/10- this was a rather boring & disappointing main event. JBL is not the best choice to carry a match. Orlando Jordan's involvement & the ending help this match. without it, i give it a 4.this has to be one of the ten worst WWE PPV's ever. Smackdown really took a dive on this one. Smackdown was already in trouble but this might be the 1st nail in the coffin.one good note is the extras. they show a classic G.A.B. match between Ric Flair & Sting for the WCW title from 1990.most of these matches are nothing more than what you see every week on Smackdown.

reviewText: live from buffalo NY i saw this event and the crowed was really into the event...i was worried that it would be on the list for horrible ppv's but it deliveredmatches:(WWE tag titles)MNM(champs)vs Animal/Hedenriech(spelling)animal got a big pop when he came out and aminal chants and LOD chants were started...decent tag match good action for a opener NEW TAG CHAMPS!! in the new lod?? Animal announces that this match was for Hawk great ending with the doomesday device which also got a big pop(3.5/5)Booker T vs Christiani mist say that this was a very diverse crowd during in this match pretty good action not exaclty MOTY but worht watchin wanted christian to win very bad he is one of my fav wrestlers..booker wins with scissor kick off top rope(4/5)(U.S. title match) Orlando Jordan(champ) vs Chris Beniotpretty good match beniot carried it with some good spots benoit got a huge pop when he entered OJ wins by htting beniots head on the exposed turnbuckle(4/5)(#1 condenderes match for WHC) Muhammad Hassan vs Undertakerthere was alot of controversy which ruined the first plans of the match im not going to explain it but it did make things interesting...first off the undertakers entrance is nothing on tv until you experienced it live it was great...alot of interferince with  hassans henchmen but undertaker prevails and chokeslams his way to the #1 spot..huge bump taken by hassan and he will never be on smackdown again(4/5)(6 mnan tag match)BWO vs Mexicoolsdecent match worth watching great entrances with all these goofy guys mexicools pick up a quick win(4/5)Rey Mysterio vs Eddie Gurrerogreat match very fast paced and entertaining rey wins with a quick roll up..if eddie won the match he got to spill the beans with the secret but that does not happen..i love this rivalry they are great in the ring togther(Bra and patnies match)Torrie wilson vs Melinacandice was the special ref so this match was stacked with hottnes melina wins but torrie and candice pose in their panties in the ring got a big popWorld HeavyWeight Championship) Batista(champ) vs JBLgreat entracnes by both guys confetti for JBL i took some home and awesome pyro for batsita ..slow paced match should have been a street fight that would have given it a little more action OJ interfiers with the ref out but batista prevails batista gets DQed after hitting JBL with the chair....the crowd was dissapoined a little with the ending but it was exciting to see batistabombs to OJ and JBLoverall a good night worth buying which is saying more than last years whichwas horrible i reccomned it

reviewText: UNDER 50: ASK FOR A REFUND FOR YOUR TIME AND MONEY, AVOID (F)50-54: MEDIOCRE & DISSAPOINTING (D)55-59: AVERAGE (C)60-64: WORTH A WATCH (C+)65-69: GOOD EVENT WORTH THE TIME AND MONEY(B)70-74: VERY GOOD (B+)75-79: GREAT EVENT, ADD THIS TO YOUR COLLECTION NOW! (A)80+: LOCK THIS BABY IN A SAFE PLACE! (A+)WWE TAG TEAM CHAMPIONSHIPMNM VS. LOD 2005SUPRISED HOW MUCH THIS GOT THE CROWD GOING, BUT THAT IS JUST WHAT AN OPENER SHOULD DO. I MUST SAY I DIDNT LIKE THIS ONE. MNM ARE A GREAT NEW AND FRESH TAG TEAM, BUT ANIMAL ISNT WHAT HE WAS MANY YEARS AGO, WHILE HEIDENREICH HAS NO WRESTLING SKILLS. AT LEAST THEY KEPT IT SHORT AND AT A QUICK PACE. NOT TOO BAD OF A MATCH, BUT I JUST DIDNT ENJOY IT THAT MUCH. HARD TO RATE AS THE CROWD SEEMED TO ENJOY IT, BUT NOTHING TO FAIL.WINNERS & NEW WWE TAG TEAM CHAMPIONS: LODRATING: 5CHRISTIAN VS. BOOKER TPRETTY SOLID MATCHUP, BUT NOT AS GOOD AS SOME OF THEIR MATCHES IN THE PAST. CROWD WAS BEHIND CHRISTIAN MOST OF THE MATCH, AS WELL AS I WAS. PRETTY DECENT PACE, AS USUAL WITH THESE TWO. SOME PARTS GOT A LITTLE SLOW AND BORING, BUT IT GOT QUICKER AND BETTER. OVERALL A DECENT MATCH, WITH A PRETTY NICE ENDING, WITH BOOKER T HITTING A SCISSORS KICK FROM THE MIDDLE ROPE. AS A WRESTLING MATCH IT WAS GOOD, BUT I THINK THESE TWO COULD HAVE DONE BETTER.WINNER: BOOKER TRATING: 6UNITED STATES CHAMPIONSHIPORLANDO JORDAN VS. CHRIS BENOITA PRETTY SOLID MATCH. NOTHING SPECIAL AS USUAL IN AN ORLANDO JORDAN MATCH, BUT BENOIT DOES HIS BEST TO KEEP THIS ONE WATCHABLE. I HAVE TO GIVE HIM PROPS FOR MAKING OJ LOOK LIKE A SOMEWHAT DECENT TECHINICAL WRESTLER. BETTER THAN I EXPECTED, AS I DID HAVE LOW EXPECTATIONS. BESIDES THE LAME BOOKING HAVING OJ RETAIN AND THE ENDING, THIS WASNT ALL THAT BAD.WINNER & STILL UNITED STATES CHAMPION: ORLANDO JORDANRATING: 5CONTENDERS MATCHUNDERTAKER VS. MUHAMMAD HASSANANOTHER SOLID MATCH. ONLY PROBLEM IS THAT THE MATCH IS TOO SHORT. ODD TO SEE NO DISQUALIFICATIONS AS THE 'TERRORISTS' THAT CARRIED HASSAN TO THE RING CONTINUED TO INTERFERE. WHAT REALLY MADE THIS MATCH STAND OUT IS THE AFTERMATH, WHERE TAKER LAST RIDES HASSAN THROUGH THE STAGE! THAT WAS SICK. OVERALL WATCHABLE, AS IT WAS KEPT SHORT.WINNER: UNDERTAKERRATING: 66 MAN TAG TEAM MATCHBWO VS. MEXICOOLSTHIS WAS A PRETTY AVERAGE MATCHUP. THIS WAS NOTHING YOU COULDNT SEE ON SMACKDOWN. THOUGH THE ENTRANCES WERE ENTERTAINING, THAT MATCH ITSELF WASNT VERY SPECIAL, THOUGH THEY DID KEEP A GOOD PACE GOING, AND IT WAS KEPT RELATIVELY SHORT. BUT IT WAS STILL OVERALL AN AVERAGE MATCH.WINNERS: MEXICOOLSRATING: 5IF EDDIE WINS, HE REVEALS REY'S SECRETEDDIE GUERRERO VS. REY MYSTERIOFINALLY WE HAVE A 'GOOD' MATCH. BUT NOW ITS THE STORYLINE THAT KEEPS THINGS DOWN. WHEN YOU HAVE THESE TWO TOGEHER IN A MATCH, YOU KNOW YOU'RE GOING TO HAVE SOMETHING GOOD. THOUGH I MUST SAY, I WAS DISSAPOINTED WITH THE ENDING. EDDIE HITS A HUGE BRAINBUSTER, BUT SOON AFTER DOMINATING, REY JUST ROLLS HIM UP FOR THE WIN. NOT BAD AT ALL, BUT SOME THINGS KEPT IT FROM BEING GREAT LIKE IT COULD HAVE BEEN.WINNER: REY MYSTERIORATING: 7BRA & PANTIES MATCHMELINA VS. TORRIE WILSONANOTHER AVERAGE WOMENS MATCHUP. THOUGH IT WAS PHYSICAL, AND THEY DID ACTUALLY WRESTLE, I DONT THINK ID GIVE THIS ONE A SECOND WATCH. I CANT PASS IT AS IT WASNT A VERY WATCHABLE MATCH, AND I WOULDNT RECOMMEND WATCHING THIS ONE.WINNER: MELINARATING: 4WORLD HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPIONSHIPBATISTA VS. JBLWHAT IN THE WORLD WAS THIS!? THIS WAS JUST A LONG, BORING BRAWL, WITH NO WRESTLING IN IT WHATSOEVER. THIS HAD LESS WRESTLING THAN THE BRA AND PANTIES MATCH, AND BELIEVE ME, IF YOU WATCHED KING OF THE RING 2002'S MAIN EVENT, YOU'D KNOW WHAT I'M TALKING ABOUT. ONLY, THOSE TWO HAVE MORE POTENTIAL AS WRESTLERS THAN THESE TWO DO. BAD MATCH TO END THIS AVERAGE PPV. HARD TO SAY SKIP THIS MATCH, AS IT WAS THE MAIN EVENT, BUT I DONT RECOMMEND A FIRST LOOK.WINNER BY DQ: JBLWINNER & STILL WORLD HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION: BATISTARATING: 3PPV RATING (41/80) = 51OVERALL, GREAT AMERICAN BASH 2005 RECIEVED A (D) GRADE, MEANING IT WAS MEDIOCRE AND DISSAPOINTING. SOUNDS LIKE A LOW GRADE, RIGHT? WELL I CANT TELL YOU HOW MUCH I THOUGHT IT FAILED BEFORE I COUNTED THE SCORE. VERY MEDIOCRE SMACKDOWN PAY PER VIEW, AND I WOULDNT RECOMMEND IT. HARD TO SPLIT BETWEEN 1 OR 2 STARS, BUT SINCE IT WAS SO CLOSE TO AN F, I HAVE TO SCORE IT THAT WAY.

reviewText: MATCH 1: WWE TAG TITLES - Heidenreich/Animal Vs MNM - 4/10Nothing really happed here and only 7 minutes long.MATCH 2: Christian vs Booker T - 5/10Nothing you wont see on smackdown every week.MATCH 3: US TITLE - Booker T Vs Chris Benoit - 6/10Pretty good but a poor ending.MATCH 4: Muhammed Hassan Vs Undertaker - 3/10Pathetic, a lot of the match is just undertaker fighting the sympesisers.MATCh 5: Rey Mysterio Vs Eddie Guerrero - 8/10The first real good match of the evening.MATCh 6: The B.W.O Vs The Mexicools - 3/10What was the point in this match.MATCH 7: BRA AND PANTIES MATCH - Melina Vs Torrie (special guest referee candice) - 2/10Good for eye candy but a crap match.MATCH 8: WORLD HEAVYWEIGHT TITLE - Batista Vs JBL - 4/10Boring match which ended in a disqualification.Overall event rating - 3/10.

reviewText: This was one of the worst WWe PPV shows ever!  Why anyone except maybe a WWe historian would consider owning it is beyond me.  If I could give it a '0' rating I would.The booking of the matches was some of the worst of all time.  Skilled wrestlers like Chris Benoit should never lose to glorified jobbers like Orlando Jordan.  The main event with Batista vs. JBL will put you to sleep.  GUAR-AN-TEE!If you're looking for quality wrestling DVDs, check out Shawn Michaels: From the Vault, Hard Knocks: The Chris Benoit Story, or The Ric Flair Collection.AVOID THIS DVD AT ALL COSTS!

reviewText: WWE Great American Bash Opener:The Great American Bash opened up with a video package looking at the main matches for tonights show. The fireworks then went off in the arena as Michael Cole and Tazz welcomed us to the Great American Bash!1st match: MNM (C) vs. Heidenreich & Animal for the WWE Tag Team Championship:A bad way to kick off the show.  The Finish:Heidenreich kicked Nitro away and then made the tag and Animal hit a flying forearm and then knocked Nitro off the apron before hitting a back suplex on Mercury. Heidenreich hit a dropkick on Nitro, and Animal went for a splash in the corner but Mercury moved and then Nitro nailed Animal with a tag belt. MNM went for the Snapshot, but Heidenreich took out Nitro and then Animal hit a powerslam. Animal and Heidenreich hit the Doomsday Device, and Animal then covered Mercury and we have new tag team champions!Winners via Pinfall: Heidenreich and AnimalRating: 4/10Backstage: Josh had an interview with Eddie which Eddie hinted the secret.2nd match: Christian vs. Booker T:The Finish:Booker went for the Scissors Kick but Christian moved and went for the Unprettier. Booker shoved him away and then hit mounted punches in the corner, but Christian powerbombed him and held the ropes on the roll up for two. Booker hotshots Christian over the top rope and then went up top and hit the missile dropkick for a near fall. Christian poked Booker in the eye and then tossed him outside. Christian followed out and went to throw Booker into the ring post, but Booker reversed and Christian went into the post. Booker sent Christian head first into the ring steps and then tossed him shoulder first into them. Booker tossed Christian back inside and then went to the middle rope and hit the Scissor Kick from the middle rope for the win!  A decent enough match.Winner via Pinfall: Booker TRating: 5/10Backstage:Steve Romero interviewed Melina and she said she would beat Torrie.3rd match: Orlando Jordan (C) vs. Chris Benoit for the United States Championship:The Finish:Benoit hit a German, but Jordan blocked the second and went for a standing switch but Benoit reversed and hit the other two. Benoit went up top and came off with the diving headbutt for a near fall. Benoit chopped away at Jordan in the corner, and then sent him into the buckle, but Jordan's head collided with Benoit's on impact. Jordan removed the turnbuckle pad, and then Benoit went for a German, but Jordan shoved him head first into the exposed turnbuckle and covered for the win!  There is no way OJ should have won this.Winner via Pinfall: Orlando JordanRating: 6/104th match: The Undertaker vs. Muhammad Hassan in a Number One Contenders Match:The Finish:The masked man tossed the Undertaker back inside and he's out. Hassan locked in the Camel Clutch but the Deadman fought to his feet and has Hassan perched on his back, and delivered an electric chair. The Undertaker then hit two splashes in the corner, and then a masked man entered and Taker hit a big boot on him. Taker then gave Hassan snake eyes, and another masked man got in the ring, and then another, but Taker tossed them out. Another masked man got inside and Taker levelled him and then went for the Tombstone on Hassan, but Hassan dropped out and went for a clothesline, but the Undertaker ducked and then nailed the chokeslam for the win.The Aftermath:The masked men entered the ring and laid a beating on the Undertaker. Taker threw one of them into the ring steps, and then kicked a chair back into one of their faces. Taker then wedged a chair on one of their throats and crashed it into the announce table. One got a chokeslam and one got tossed into the announce table. The Undertaker got back in the ring, and Hassan shoved Daivari into him. Another masked man entered, and Taker knocked him down, but Daivari got on his back and Taker tossed him outside. Another masked man got in the ring and Taker nailed him with the Tombstone and then went outside for Daivari. Taker tossed him head first into the side of the announce table, and Daivari went right through it! Hassan crawled up the aisle but Taker went after him and then Taker chokeslammed him onto the steel stage. Taker ripped a panel off the stage and there is now a hole on the entrance way. Taker removed another panel and then gave Hassan the Last Ride down the hole! Hassan went crashing through as the Deadman held his hand high as the Number One Contender. We take a look down the hole, and he landed on a steel beam, and he is convulsing and knocked out.  The Aftermath made the match!Winner via Pinfall: The UndertakerRating: 4/10Backstage:Romero interviwed Torrie about her match with Melina later in the night.5th match: The Blue World Order vs. Mexicool in a Six Man Tag Match:The Finish:Crazy hit snapmare and then a dropkick to the face for two. Juvy tagged in and worked over the arm of Nova some more. Nova fought out and hit a big boot. Juvy tagged in Psicosis and Nova tagged Richards. Richards with a back elbow to Psicosis and then some chops and a back body drop. Juvy came flying in but Richards moved and then hit a side slam on Psicosis and covered but Super Crazy broke the fall. Mexicool and the bWo brawled to the outside while Richards got caught up in the ropes. Super Crazy hit a moonsault and then Psicosis hit the guillotine legdrop and then pinned Richards for the win.  This match was way to quick.Winners via Pinfall: MexicoolRating: 3/10Backstage:Rey was preying backstage with Dominick.6th match: Rey Mysterio vs. Eddie Guerrero in a Secrets Match:The Finish:Rey hit a springboard dropkick to the back sending Eddie into position for the 619. Rey scored with the 619 and then Dropped the Dime but Eddie rolled out of the way. Eddie hit the Three Amigos and then went up for the Frog Splash but Rey rolled to the ropes and Eddie jumped down. Eddie gave Rey the Three Amigos for a second time and then he stared at Dominic before hitting a brainbuster. Eddie went up top, staring at Dominic and came off with the Frog Splash onto Mysterio and then laid over him but Rey rolled him up and got the win!  The ending was very weak.Winner via Pinfall: Rey MysterioRating: 6/10Backstage:Mathews interviewed JBL and JBL guarenteed that he would beat Batista.7th match: Melina vs. Torrie Wilson in a Bra & Panties Match:Melina went to remove the pants but Torrie kicked her off. Melina hit a double axe handle to the back of Torrie and went for the pants again. Torrie kicked Melina in the head and then hit a flying clothesline and a dropkick. Torrie hit a suplex and then floated over and went for the pants but Melina monkey flipped her off. Melina hotshotted Torrie on the ropes and went for the pants and Melina has the win!  I was pissed that Torrie couldn't win but what can you do?Winner: MelinaRating: 2/10Main Event: Batista (C) vs. John Bradshaw Layfield for the World Heavyweight Championship:The Finish:Bradshaw scored with the Clothesline From Hell and covered, but the referee is still groggy. Bradshaw screamed at the referee and then called for the Clothesline again. JBL went for it but walked in the spinebuster from Batista. Jordan got in the ring and charged at Batista but was back dropped to the outside. Batusta hit some shoulders in the corner and then clotheslined Bradshaw followed by a power slam. Jordan grabbed the chair and went to nail Batista, but Batista pulled him into the ring. Batista liad out both Jordan and Bradshaw with the chair, and the referee saw it and called for the bell.  I was ticked at the ending but I thought that the match was good.Winner via DQ: JBLRating: 7/10Match of the Night: Batista vs. JBLWorst Match of the Night: Melina vs. TorrieMove of the Night: Undertaker giving Hassan the Last Ride through the stage!Comments: It was close to 3 stars but Hassan/Taker was bad and so Eddie/Rey should have been better.

reviewText: I really do hate giving PPVs a bad review, but some really do deserve one. Like this one, The Great American Bash 2005. Since the WWE revived the Bash, it hasn't really ever had a good show. This is no exception, this was a very boring show.Let's rundown the matches:WWE Tag Team Championship MatchMNM (Johnny Nitro & Joey Mercury w/ Melina) (champions) vs Road Warrior Animal & HeidenreichThis was one of the better matches of the show. It served to fire up the crowd as the opener, and the crowd were definitely into it, with chants for LOD throughout the match. For his age, Animal moved pretty well in the ring and MNM were their usual selves. This match excited the crowd because of a title change, and was definitely one of the best matches here. (3.5/5)Booker T (w/ Sharmell) vs ChristianAn average match. Booker has never really excited me, but it's interesting to see Sharmell with him when he was a face. The crowd is evenly split between both men, and both put on a good show, but overall, this match was just... average. Booker wins. (3/5)United States Championship MatchOrlando Jordan (champion) vs Chris BenoitBoring match! Orlando Jordan was a horrible US champion, mainly cos he was dull and had no personality. Chris tried his best here, he tried to keep the pace going, but this was slow and not good at all. Orlando wins. (2/5)#1 Contender Match for the World Heavyweight ChampionshipThe Undertaker vs Muhammad Hassan (w/ Daivari & symphathisers)The #1 contender bit of this match was basically forgotten in favour of Hassan trying anything he could to overcome Taker. Taker had the odds stacked against him as Hassan brought five masked goons to ringside with him, who surrounded the ring. What I don't get is, when they came into the ring and attacked Taker, shouldn't that have been an instant DQ? Thankfully Taker wins, and then sends Hassan on his last ride through the stage. This was one of the better matches of the night, but I knocked some points off due to the constant interference and the fact that Daivari never shut up for the whole match. (3/5)The Mexicools (Super Crazy, Juventud & Psicosis) vs The Blue World Order (Big Stevie Cool, The Blue Meanie & Hollywood Nova)This match was really short, less then 5 minutes. I never understood the BWO, they were just weird. I get that they were mocking the NWO, but it was just bizarre. For what we saw of the action, it was pretty good. The Mexicools pick up the win. (2.5/5)Rey Mysterio (w/ Dominick) vs Eddie GuerreroThis match was incredibly depressing. Great wrestling on show from Rey & Eddie, but the storyline made me really sad. Why did they have to involve a child in it? Dominick is really adorable, and I have to admit the shots of him during the match added to the feel. If Eddie won this match, he'd reveal Rey's secret about Dominick (that Eddie is actually his father). Rey won but Eddie revealed the secret anyway (check the extras for footage of that). I'm torn on how to rate this, the wrestling was top notch, but the storyline is sad, I'll go for a middle score. (3/5)Bra & Panties MatchTorrie Wilson vs Melinaw/ Candice Michelle as Special Guest RefereeNow I'm a sucker for attractive women, so I quite liked this match. Candice looked HOT as the referee, and both Melina and Torrie looked great too. There were actually some good moves displayed too, and of course seeing the divas in their underwear is a plus. Melina wins, but Torrie & Candice strip her anyway, before Candice strips off to join Torrie. A good little match here. (3/5)World Heavyweight Championship MatchBatista (champion) vs JBLI swear this match almost sent me to sleep. I think it was during JBL's 3 minute long sleeper hold. Boring! Fans don't pay to see JBL apply a hold that not only makes Batista pass out, but also everybody watching. This match only got interesting after the ref was knocked out and a chair was brought in. Orlando Jordan appearing was unneeded, and it was cop-out to end a PPV main event on a DQ. Batista's angry face after he was DQed cracked me up though, and he went crazy and attacked Jordan & JBL with the chair. Batista then left the ring, and JBL was announced as the winner by DQ. JBL was smiling like he won the title and Batista went back to attack him and Jordan again. A horrible main event. (1/5)As for the extras, there's three of them.The first is a strange little skit thing with the BWO. It's in black and white and sees Hollywood Nova yelling at Stevie for not having their bikes ready while the Blue Meanie acts like a dork. Weird.The second is footage from Smackdown where Eddie reveals Rey's secret, that he's not Dominick's father. Eddie is a total jerk here, but also funny. Dominick runs away from Rey, through the crowd and Rey follows him. Eddie gets in the ring and says something like "I'm not that bad, am I? What, do I smell or something?" - it made me laugh. Then he proceeds to sit down and tell everybody a story about how Rey ended up with Dominick.And finally, there's a match from The Great American Bash 1990 where Ric Flair faces Sting for the World Heavyweight Title. This is a WCW match, and it's really cool to see. The wrestling on display is great, there's some inteference from the Four Horsemen, and Sting wins the title. Really cool old school match.Overall, this was a rather dull PPV. There were a couple of decent matches (the opening tag, Rey vs Eddie, Taker vs Hassan, the divas match) but everything else was boring, and the main event was rubbish. The 1990 GAB match is worth a look if you haven't seen it though. 2 stars.
